value.description: A synthetic performance-enhancing drug developed for space marines during the early days of interplanetary warfare. Go-juice blocks pain, increases movement speed, and improves the user's melee and shooting abilities. The military chemists who created it were never able to remove its addictiveness. Some saw this as a downside; others saw it as a benefit. Withdrawal symptoms include intense tiredness and muscular exhaustion, increased hunger, and hypersensitivity to pain. The withdrawal is relatively brief, however, lasting about 11 days without further doses.\n\nDespite its name, it is not recommended to drink it.
Go-juice injected into the bloodstream, supercharging combat-related abilities. Upon initial injection, it increases psyfocus by 15%.
I feel pumped but centered. I'll take on all challengers. Come get some.
Because of a go-juice addiction, this person needs to regularly consume the drug to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
I can't think straight. My limbs feel heavy, I'm tired, hungry, and my vision blacks out here and there. Worst of all, I feel a jolt of pain at the gentlest touch.
A built-up tolerance to go-juice. The more severe this tolerance is, the more go-juice it takes to reach the same state of readiness.
